The Butcher is a node 1 Nemesis Monster included in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
There once was a man who could not hide his fear. He wore a mask that transformed his cowardice to rage. In turn, the man transformed into a monster. All that remained was a devouring fury that stalked the night, collecting the fearful faces of others. Kingdom Death: Monster Core Rulebook, Showdown: Butcher, pg 169

The Butcher is the remains of a Forsaker swallowed by long years of wrestling with the primal rage that gave him power. Nothing remains of the man, just a mess of flesh clinging to the insides of the Forsaker's armor, animated by nihilistic fury to destroy on the road through oblivion.

The Butcher collects the lanterns and skinned faces of his victims, a perversion of the humanity that echoes inside its near hollow armor.Resin Limited Release Description

The King's Man is a node 2 Nemesis Monster included in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
There was once a monster that was to lead its master's regal procession. First the monster came as a herald, then its hungry masters. So fierce were the monster's masters that it never thought to protect its own back, knowing what horrors lay behind it.Kingdom Death: Monster Core Rulebook, Showdown: King's Man, pg. 161

The King's Men herald the appearance of powerful entities such as the Scribe and the King. From a distance the strangely fashioned lantern halberds are glowing harbingers of the mountainous King lumbering behind. Resin Limited Release Description (Note: This is an early lore blurb, so aspects of it may no longer be relevant).

The Lion Knight is a node 2 Nemesis monster included in the Lion Knight Expansion.
Lore.
"There was once a monster who was shunned by its creator and left to wander the darkness. Lost in the world of humans, it was driven insane in its attempts to comprehend them. Now, the only reality it accepts exists deep inside its hollow, broken mind."Lion Knight Expansion Rulebook, Showdown: Lion Knight

Incapable of emotion, the Lion Knight seeks to understand the world around it through its bizarre, self-serving stage productions. Between performances, it is a distant husk, unaffected by the normal world.

When the time comes, "actors" are gathered by the Lion Knight's masked retinue to join it onstage. There, it hopes to capture and vicariously experience their excitement, fears, and ultimately, their deaths. However, it remains up to the survivors to decide whether or not they stick to their scripts.Lion Knight Expansion Rulebook, pg. 1

Three brother generals command the vast armies of the Golden Entities domain. Each imbued with a different temperament and a strong will of their own. The middle brother is the most attached to the human industry and artistry. He cultivates a courtly civilized appearance and graceful swordsmanship, surrounding himself with human thralls allowing them to enjoy their short tragic existence in his awesome presence.Kingdom Death Shop Description

The Lonely Tree is a nemesis monster found in the Lonely Tree Expansion.
Lore.
If you can see the Lonely Tree for what it really is, it's probably too late. This carnivorous organism hypnotizes anything that comes near, luring prey with hallucinations of their innermost desires. Once they draw near, the hallucinations turn to ceaseless dreams, while the roots consume the victim in their sleep.

With each meal, a grotesque bulge appears on the Lonely Tree's branches which slowly swells and takes on certain qualities of the devoured as they are digested. This "fruit" of the Lonely Tree is its true prize, as eating these conglomerations of phytohormones and human gristle can have beneficial (albeit bizarre) side effects. However, make sure to handle them gently while they are close to the tree, as the chemical volatility of the unripened morsels doubles as the Lonely Tree's primary form of self-defense!Lonely Tree Expansion Rulebook, pg. 1

There was once a woman who loved a sad man with a hole in his heart. The harder she tried to fill it, the more drained she felt. When there was nothing left of her, she killed herself under an old tree and let its roots drink her blood. Soon after, the sad man disappeared from the settlement. The tree bore a tear-shaped fruit.Lonely Tree Expansion Rulebook, Showdown: Lonely Tree, pg. 11

The Manhunter is a node 1 Nemesis monster included in the Manhunter Expansion.
Lore.
"Hailing from a far away city, the Manhunter is a sadistic killer. It brutally executes survivors, cowing settlements into willingly submitting people to it. No one knows why it abducts survivors, or what they're used for, only that once taken, they are never seen again. Settlements will have to choose: take up arms against their fellow man, or accept the blood tax.

The Manhunter is a brutal foe, preferring to break enemies' bodies before ending their lives. If it can be defeated, the scarred survivors will benefit from the monster's invaluable hunting tools. If not, the settlement can submit to its will and trade their kin for resources."Manhunter expansion rulebook, p.1

is a story event found in the Lonely Tree Expansion.

Nemesis Encounter.
Departing survivors do not have a Hunt Phase. Instead, select the Lonely Tree's monster level from the table and st up the showdown accordingly. Unless directed to by the timeline, the Lonely Tree may not be chosen for a Nemesis Encounter.

Lore.
There was once a woman who loved a sad man with a hole in his heart. The harder she tried to fill it, the more drained she felt. When there was nothing left of her, she killed herself under and old tree and let its roots drink her blood. Soon after, the sad man disappeared from the settlement. The tree bore a tear-shaped fruit.

Aftermath.
Update the settlement record sheet to indicate the monster level of this encounter.

Victory.

Level 1+
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.

With the tree dead, the survivors safely harvest its bounty. Some fruit bear the tortured features of past meals. For each Nightmare Fruit on the showdown board (not on the tree's branches), gain 1 random basic resource. 
The group gains the following rewards:

If the settlement has innovated Cooking when they defeat a level 3+ Lonely Tree, the fruit of the Lonely Tree is baked into a foul-smelling dish that sprouts thick black hair as it cooks. As the survivors consume it, they become nauseated and see the same hair sprout from their bodies, tangling and growing into each other's until they are indistinguishable. All victorious survivors gain the following ability:

Super Hair: You may spend to freely exchange any tokens with adjacent survivors who have Super Hair.

Defeat.

Something rotten is found at the edge of the settlement. Gain 1 Nightmare Fruit strange resource.

is a Slenderman story event found in the Slenderman Expansion.

Lore.
One day, a lonely man came home and found his long, lonely hours no longer troubled him. In fact, he could not remember them at all. Each day, he left home with a chilling ache in his bones and no memory of the day before. One day, he came home to find that he was not alone, after all. Then he was gone.

Departing survivors do not have a Hunt Phase. Instead, select the Slenderman's monster level from the table and set up the showdown accordingly.

No one remembers, do not gain Hunt XP.

Rewards.

If the settlement does not already have it, gain the Dark Water Research innovation. Roll 1d10 and add the Slenderman's level to the result. The group gains any listed resources or gear. Add them to the settlement's storage.

If the settlement has Face Painting when they defeat a level 3+ Slenderman:

Nominate a survivor. They paint their face to resemble the fading memory of the Slenderman and gain the Forgettable ability.

Forgettable: Gain +2 permanent evasion. Forgettable survivors cannot be encouraged.

Defeat.

The survivors left, never to return. No one remembers.

Slenderman is a node 2 Nemesis monster included in the Slenderman Expansion.
Lore.
White Speakers whisper stories of the walking water. An entity capable of making people vanish without a trace, like the water of an unwatched urn. It's motives inscrutable and it's description warping with each new telling. Little is known of the Slender Man as it leaves nothingness in it's wake.Kingdom Death Shop Description

"The Slenderman is a dark, cold hole in the memories of the few that have seen it and lived. Within this chilling gap of recollection, terror thrives, growing into panic and jumbled tales of warning."Slenderman Expansion Rulebook, pg. 1

"One day, a lonely man came home and found his long, lonely hours no longer troubled him. In fact, he could not remember them at all. Each day, he left home with a chilling ache in his bones and no memory of the day before. One day, he came home to find that he was not alone, after all. Then he was gone"Slenderman Expansion Rulebook, Showdown: Slenderman, pg. 9

The Slenderman primarily exists on a strange, watery plane of existence, referred to as the Dark Place. The creature has the ability to move back and forth between the human world and the Dark Place at will. The Slenderman is also able to imprison survivors in the Dark Place, sending them to drown via a pitch black pool of water which forms at the survivors feet.

After its initial arrival, the Slenderman latches onto a settlement and torments its populace, unseen from the shadows. Slowly driving the survivors into madness. Even survivors who have directly fought against the monster will immediately forget about its existence after the fight has ended. All that is left behind is the strange remnants of the Dark Place for the survivors to puzzle over.

The Hand is a node 3 Nemesis monster included in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Lore.
There was once an entity that knew everything, but never spoke. For every secret that escaped, it became weaker and its enemies stronger.Kingdom Death: Monster Core Rulebook, Showdown: The Hand, pg. 159

There was once a fearsome monster that was trained by the Hand]] to be a steed for the Goblin. However, upon smelling its new master, the monster's mind shattered and it ran into the unknown, foaming at the mouth and biting the noses off the stone faced floor.Kingdom Death: Monster Core Rulebook, Showdown: Screaming Antelope, pg 165 

They say that The Hand once trained a great, horned beast to be ridden by him alone. As the beast carried The Hand from one terrible task to the next, its appetite grew, and its horns took on twisted shapes.Kingdom Death: Monster Core Rulebook, Legendary Monsters - Mad Steed, pg 143

Limited Release.
The Hand was originally released as a limited resin release with a First Run limited to 450 miniatures and was originally called the "King's Hand" . Since the release of the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game, the resin miniature will no longer be released as an Encore.

Lore.
Prior to the release of the Core game, the Hand's lore was considerably different. This store description should not be considered canon unless new information proves otherwise.

The King's Hand are the King's highest ranking guard. They see through the eyes of every King's Men that patrols the King's territory. The Hands are highly intelligent master swordsmen.
